result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edwin Esteves

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edwin Esteves appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph F Owens Aty appeared by video for Edwin Esteves.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, Co. Ord. 63.01 to which defendant pled no contest.
Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $150.00 plus all costs and surcharges by 4/21/23.Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Edwin Esteves in court.  Attorney Joseph F Owens Aty in court for Edwin Esteves.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Owens has received discovery and an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NH.

Defendant Edwin Esteves in court with Attorney Joseph F Owens.    Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 075521,
Payable Number: 1024217,
Receipt Number: 22RP031395,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/5/22 @ 2:30p
